json-only-content.description: Enable/disable its operation when telemetry-stream-encoding-config.encoding is specified to literal ENC_JSON_IETF within any subscription. If it is set to true, json format will only act on real data content while telemetry message layer will keep on gpb format.

cpu-max-usage.description: Maximum usage of the main control board's CPU used when telemetry collects data.

op-field.description: Reference field in the filter criterion. Different paths support different reference fields.

op-type.description: Reference to the op-type of the filter criterion.

op-value.description: Comparison value of the filter criterion. Op-value must be an integer and the maximum value range is [0, 4294967295]. For the actual value range, see the definition of op-field in the YANG model.

conditions.description: List of filter criteria, including the filter information such as op-field, op-type, and op-value.

op-field.description: Reference to the op-field of the filter criterion.

op-type.description: Reference to the op-type of the filter criterion.

op-value.description: Comparison value of the filter criterion. Op-value must be an integer and the maximum value range is [0, 4294967295]. For the actual value range, see the definition of op-field in the YANG model.

config.description: Configure the parameters for a filter criterion.

state.description: Operational state of a filter criterion.

telemetry-sensor-path-filter-attribute-c.description: Configuration parameters relating to the configured name of the telemetry sensor path filter.

name.description: Filter name for the telemetry sensor path filter.

condition-relation.description: Relationship between filter criteria in a filter of a sampling path.

telemetry-sensor-path-filter-config.description: Condition-based filtering's parameter of the sampling path. If the conditions are met, the data is reported.

filters.description: List of the top level container for filters. If the filter criteria are met, sampled data is sent to a collector. A filter and heartbeat interval or redundancy suppression cannot be configured at the same time.

name.description: Filter name of a sampling path.

config.description: Configure the parameters for a filter in a sampling path.

state.description: Operational state of a filter in a sampling path.

suppress-period.description: Suppression period for customized event reporting.

telemetry-sensor-path-config-self-define.description: Configuration parameters relating to the grouping of data model paths comprising a sensor grouping.

path.description: Path to a section of operational state of interest (the sensor).

telemetry-stream-destination-with-vpn-co.description: Configuration parameters for the stream destinations.

destination-address.description:
IP address of the telemetry stream destination.
When the destination-address is an IPv4 address, it can only be configured as an class A/B/C address.
When the destination-address is an IPv6 address, it cannot be configured as an unspecified address, multicast address, link-local address, loopback address, IPv4-compatible IPv6 address, or IPv4-mapped IPv6 address.

destination-port.description: Protocol (UDP or TCP) port number for the telemetry stream destination.

vpn-instance.description: Name of a VPN instance for the telemetry stream destination.

protocol.description: Selection of the transport protocol for the telemetry stream.

tls.description: Enable/disable data encryption at the transport layer. If encryption is allowed, whether the data is encrypted depends on the SSL policy of the gRPC client. If an SSL policy is configured, data at the transport layer is encrypted. Otherwise, the data is not encrypted.

telemetry-system_schema.description:
Top level configuration and state for the
device's telemetry system.

sensor-group.description:
List of telemetry sensory groups on the local
system, where a sensor grouping represents a resuable
grouping of multiple paths and exclude filters.

sensor-group-id.description:
Reference to the name or identifier of the
sensor grouping

config.description:
Configuration parameters relating to the
telemetry sensor grouping

state.description:
State information relating to the telemetry
sensor group

sensor-paths.description:
Top level container to hold a set of sensor
paths grouped together

sensor-path.description:
List of paths in the model which together
comprise a sensor grouping. Filters for each path
to exclude items are also provided.

path.description: Reference to the path of interest

config.description:
Configuration parameters to configure a set
of data model paths as a sensor grouping

reset-when-start.description: Enable/disable clearing a field in the sampling path when a sampling sensor group is associated with subscription. The fields that can be cleared in different sampling paths are different. The value true indicates that the field is cleared, and the value false indicates that the field is not cleared. Currently, only the sampling path huawei-qos:qos/qosPortQueueStatInfos/qosPortQueueStatInfo allows reset-when-start to be set to true.

state.description:
Configuration parameters to configure a set
of data model paths as a sensor grouping

reset-when-start.description: Enable/disable clearing a field in the sampling path when a sampling sensor group is associated with subscription. The fields that can be cleared in different sampling paths are different. The value true indicates that the field is cleared, and the value false indicates that the field is not cleared. Currently, only the sampling path huawei-qos:qos/global-query/default-queue-statisticss/default-queue-statistics allows reset-when-start to be set to true.

filters.description: List of the top level container for filters. If the filter criteria are met, sampled data is sent to a collector. A filter and heartbeat interval or redundancy suppression cannot be configured at the same time.

sensor-paths-self-define-event.description: Configure the top level container to hold a set of customized events' sensor paths grouped together. Customized events and heartbeat interval or redundancy suppression cannot be configured at the same time. A customized event can take effect only after at least one filter criterion is configured for the event.

path.description: Reference to the path of interest.

config.description: Configure the parameters for a customized event.

state.description: Operational state of a customized event.

destination-groups.description:
Top level container for destination group configuration
and state.

destination-group.description:
List of destination-groups. Destination groups allow the
reuse of common telemetry destinations across the
telemetry configuration. An operator references a
set of destinations via the configurable
destination-group-identifier.

A destination group may contain one or more telemetry
destinations

group-id.description: Unique identifier for the destination group

config.description: Top level config container for destination groups

group-id.description: Unique identifier for the destination group

state.description: Top level state container for destination groups

group-id.description: Unique identifier for destination group

destinations.description:
The destination container lists the destination
information such as IP address and port of the
telemetry messages from the network element.

destination-address.description:
Reference to the destination address of the
telemetry stream

destination-port.description:
Reference to the port number of the stream
destination

config.description:
Configuration parameters relating to
telemetry destinations

protocol.description: Selection of the transport protocol for the telemetry stream.

tls.description: Enable/disable data encryption at the transport layer. If encryption is allowed, whether the data is encrypted depends on the SSL policy of the gRPC client. If an SSL policy is configured, data at the transport layer is encrypted. Otherwise, the data is not encrypted.

state.description:
State information associated with
telemetry destinations

protocol.description: Selection of the transport protocol for the telemetry stream.

tls.description: Whether data encryption at the transport layer is allowed. If encryption is allowed, whether the data is encrypted depends on the SSL policy of the gRPC client. If an SSL policy is configured, data at the transport layer is encrypted. Otherwise, the data is not encrypted.

destinations-with-vpn.description: Configure the destination container to list the information about the destination with the VPN such as IP address, port, and VPN of the telemetry messages from the network element.

destination-with-vpn.description: Configure the telemetry stream destinations, including vpn-instance.

destination-address.description: Reference to the destination address of the telemetry stream.

destination-port.description: Reference to the port number of the stream destination.

vpn-instance.description: Name of a VPN instance for the telemetry stream destination.

config.description: Configure the parameters relating to telemetry destinations.

state.description: Telemetry destinations-associated state.

subscriptions.description:
This container holds information for both persistent
and dynamic telemetry subscriptions.

persistent.description:
This container holds information relating to persistent
telemetry subscriptions. A persistent telemetry
subscription is configued locally on the device through
configuration, and is persistent across device restarts or
other redundancy changes.

subscription.description:
List of telemetry subscriptions. A telemetry
subscription consists of a set of collection
destinations, stream attributes, and associated paths to
state information in the model (sensor data)

subscription-name.description:
Reference to the identifier of the subscription
itself. The id will be the handle to refer to the
subscription once created

config.description:
Config parameters relating to the telemetry
subscriptions on the local device

local-source-port.description: The source port of UDP packets from the device to a telemetry collector destination.

tls.description: Enable/disable data encryption at the transport layer. If encryption is allowed, whether the data is encrypted depends on the SSL policy of the gRPC client. If an SSL policy is configured, data at the transport layer is encrypted. Otherwise, the data is not encrypted.

state.description:
State parameters relating to the telemetry
subscriptions on the local device

local-source-port.description: The source port of UDP packets from the device to a telemetry collector destination.

tls.description: Whether data encryption at the transport layer is allowed. If encryption is allowed, whether the data is encrypted depends on the SSL policy of the gRPC client. If an SSL policy is configured, data at the transport layer is encrypted. Otherwise, the data is not encrypted.

sensor-profiles.description:
A sensor profile is a set of sensor groups or
individual sensor paths which are associated with a
telemetry subscription. This is the source of the
telemetry data for the subscription to send to the
defined collectors.

sensor-profile.description:
List of telemetry sensor groups used
in the subscription

sensor-group.description: Reference to the telemetry sensor group name

config.description:
Configuration parameters related to the sensor
profile for a subscription

state.description:
State information relating to the sensor profile
for a subscription

destination-groups.description:
A subscription may specify destination addresses.
If the subscription supplies destination addresses,
the network element will be the initiator of the
telemetry streaming, sending it to the destination(s)
specified.

If the destination set is omitted, the subscription
preconfigures certain elements such as paths and
sample intervals under a specified subscription ID.
In this case, the network element will NOT initiate an
outbound connection for telemetry, but will wait for
an inbound connection from a network management
system.

It is expected that the network management system
connecting to the network element will reference
the preconfigured subscription ID when initiating
a subscription.

destination-group.description:
Identifier of the previously defined destination
group

group-id.description:
The destination group id references a configured
group of destinations for the telemetry stream.

config.description:
Configuration parameters related to telemetry
destinations.

group-id.description:
The destination group id references a reusable
group of destination addresses and ports for
the telemetry stream.

state.description:
State information related to telemetry
destinations

group-id.description:
The destination group id references a reusable
group of destination addresses and ports for
the telemetry stream.

dynamic.description:
This container holds information relating to dynamic
telemetry subscriptions. A dynamic subscription is
typically configured through an RPC channel, and does not
persist across device restarts, or if the RPC channel is
reset or otherwise torn down.

subscription.description:
List representation of telemetry subscriptions that
are configured via an inline RPC, otherwise known
as dynamic telemetry subscriptions.

subscription-id.description:
Reference to the identifier of the subscription
itself. The id will be the handle to refer to the
subscription once created

state.description:
State information relating to dynamic telemetry
subscriptions.

sensor-paths.description:
Top level container to hold a set of sensor
paths grouped together

sensor-path.description:
List of paths in the model which together
comprise a sensor grouping. Filters for each path
to exclude items are also provided.

path.description: Reference to the path of interest

state.description:
State information for a dynamic subscription's
paths of interest

global.description: Configure the global attribute of telemetry.

config.description: Configure the parameters relating to the telemetry global attribute.

state.description: Operational state of information relating to the telemetry global attribute.

sensor-group.description:
List of telemetry sensory groups on the local
system, where a sensor grouping represents a resuable
grouping of multiple paths and exclude filters.

sensor-group-id.description:
Reference to the name or identifier of the
sensor grouping

config.description:
Configuration parameters relating to the
telemetry sensor grouping

state.description:
State information relating to the telemetry
sensor group

Top level container to hold a set of sensor
paths grouped together

List of paths in the model which together
comprise a sensor grouping. Filters for each path
to exclude items are also provided.

path.description: Reference to the path of interest

config.description:
Configuration parameters to configure a set
of data model paths as a sensor grouping

reset-when-start.description: Enable/disable clearing a field in the sampling path when a sampling sensor group is associated with subscription. The fields that can be cleared in different sampling paths are different. The value true indicates that the field is cleared, and the value false indicates that the field is not cleared. Currently, only the sampling path huawei-qos:qos/qosPortQueueStatInfos/qosPortQueueStatInfo allows reset-when-start to be set to true.

state.description:
Configuration parameters to configure a set
of data model paths as a sensor grouping

Customized events and heartbeat interval or redundancy suppression cannot be configured at the same time. A customized event can take effect only after at least one filter criterion is configured for the event.

Reference to the name or identifier of the

State information relating to the telemetry
sensor group

op-field.description: Reference to the op-field of the filter criterion.

op-type.description: Reference to the op-type of the filter criterion.

destination-groups_schema.description:
A subscription may specify destination addresses.
If the subscription supplies destination addresses,
the network element will be the initiator of the
telemetry streaming, sending it to the destination(s)
specified.

If the destination set is omitted, the subscription
preconfigures certain elements such as paths and
sample intervals under a specified subscription ID.
In this case, the network element will NOT initiate an
outbound connection for telemetry, but will wait for
an inbound connection from a network management
system.

It is expected that the network management system
connecting to the network element will reference
the preconfigured subscription ID when initiating
a subscription.

State information related to telemetry

group-id.description:
The destination group id references a reusable
group of destination addresses and ports for
the telemetry stream.

subscription-id.description:
Reference to the identifier of the subscription
itself. The id will be the handle to refer to the
subscription once created

state.description:
State information relating to dynamic telemetry
subscriptions.

sensor-paths.description:
Top level container to hold a set of sensor
paths grouped together

sensor-path.description:
List of paths in the model which together
comprise a sensor grouping. Filters for each path
to exclude items are also provided.

path.description: Reference to the path of interest

state.description:
State information for a dynamic subscription's
paths of interest

sensor-profiles_schema.description:
A sensor profile is a set of sensor groups or
individual sensor paths which are associated with a
telemetry subscription. This is the source of the
telemetry data for the subscription to send to the
defined collectors.

sensor-profile.description:
List of telemetry sensor groups used
in the subscription

sensor-group.description: Reference to the telemetry sensor group name

config.description:
Configuration parameters related to the sensor
profile for a subscription

state.description:
State information relating to the sensor profile
for a subscription

sensor-group.description: Reference to the telemetry sensor group name

config.description:
Configuration parameters related to the sensor
profile for a subscription

state.description:
State information relating to the sensor profile
for a subscription

dynamic_schema.description:
This container holds information relating to dynamic
telemetry subscriptions. A dynamic subscription is
typically configured through an RPC channel, and does not
persist across device restarts, or if the RPC channel is
reset or otherwise torn down.

subscription.description:
List representation of telemetry subscriptions that
are configured via an inline RPC, otherwise known
as dynamic telemetry subscriptions.

subscription-id.description:
Reference to the identifier of the subscription
itself. The id will be the handle to refer to the
subscription once created

state.description:
State information relating to dynamic telemetry
subscriptions.

sensor-paths.description:
Top level container to hold a set of sensor
paths grouped together

sensor-path.description:
List of paths in the model which together
comprise a sensor grouping. Filters for each path
to exclude items are also provided.

path.description: Reference to the path of interest

state.description:
State information for a dynamic subscription's
paths of interest

global_schema.description: Configure the global attribute of telemetry.

config.description: Configure the parameters relating to the telemetry global attribute.

state.description: Operational state of information relating to the telemetry global attribute.
